Package io.github.bluelhf.tasks

Class Observable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.bluelhf.tasks.Observable<T>
  • public class Observable<T>
extends Object
    An Observable essentially acts like a normal variable, except it can have listeners that run some code every time the value changes. The listeners are executed in order of priority, and priority is given when registering a listener.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Observable()
      Creates a new Observable with no value.
      Observable​(T object)
      Creates a new Observable with the given value.

      Checks whether this observable has been assigned a value or not.

      Adds the given consumer to this observable's consumer map

      Sets the value of this Observable.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Observable

        public Observable()
        Creates a new Observable with no value.

      • Observable

        public Observable​(T object)
        Creates a new Observable with the given value. Causes future calls to hasBeenSet() to return true.
        Parameters:
        object - The value to give the Observable.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set​(T object)
        Sets the value of this Observable. Causes future calls to hasBeenSet() to return true.
        Parameters:
        object - The value to set this Observable's value to.

      • hasBeenSet

        public boolean hasBeenSet()
        Checks whether this observable has been assigned a value or not.
        Returns:
        True if a value, even null, has been assigned to this observable.

      • get

        public T get()
        Returns the current value of this Observable
        Returns:
        The current value of this Observable

      • getConsumers

        public Collection<BiConsumer<T,​T>> getConsumers()
        Returns all of the change consumers of this Observable
        Returns:
        A Collection of BiConsumers, which is backed by the consumer map of this observable.

      • listen

        public void listen​(BiConsumer<T,​T> changeConsumer,
                   int priority)
        Adds the given consumer to this observable's consumer map
        Parameters:
        changeConsumer - The change consumer, accepting the old and new value for T.
        priority - The priority of the consumer

      • unlisten

        public void unlisten​(BiConsumer<T,​T> changeConsumer)
        Removes a consumer via a reference to the consumer object
        Parameters:
        changeConsumer - The consumer object to remove.
